place.name: GOULCEBY
place.gazetteerText: GOULCEBY, or Goulsby, a parish in Horncastle district, Lincoln; on the Wolds, near the river Bain, 6½ miles N of Horncastle town and r. station. Post town, Scamblesby, under Horncastle. Acres, 1, 440. Real property, £1, 890. Pop., 3 44. Houses, 79. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £136. Patron, the Rev. J. M. Lister. The church is modern; and there are chapels for Wesleyans, Primitive Methodists, and Free Methodists, and a public school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
